reviewText: Difficult to find much on this game. Glad I was able to come across this one!
It was Awesome!!  Exactly what the seller said it be!  :)))
If one is into college basketball, this is a must have game for your collection.
See two of the greatest players to play the game of basketball. Great quality!!!! Bird vs Magic in the 1979 NCAA Championship game is a must see!!!!!

A great presentation of a greta college basketball game.  I did not realize that the DVD would provide the full footage of the game (minus commercials).  I saw the actual game and this DVD allowed me to relive all of the anticipation and excitment of when the game actaully took place.  I will treasure having this DVD in my sports video library.

I am a huge MSU fan, but wasn't alive to enjoy this spectacle when it happened.  This is a great document of that time and an event that changed sports in America.  Naturally, this is also where most people first got a glimpse of Magic and Bird in action.  The picture quality is very good for archived footage from 1979, the audio is adequate as well.

You get the pre- and post-game coverage (which was refreshingly short compared to the all-day affairs we have now) and, of course, the complete game.  The commercials have been edited out, so you get pure game after the quick pre-show. There aren't really any extras to speak of.

The only downside I can see is that this is actually not a very interesting or exciting game all on its own.  The real excitement happened in the games leading up to this.  Bird and Magic would have other -better- opportunities to appear "on-stage" in their professional careers.  So if you keep that in mind, this is a great buy for a Bird, Magic, MSU or ISU fan.

I would recommend the book "When March Went Mad" as a great companion to this DVD.
